solutions_of_the_month.one_sentence_description: A demand-controlled kitchen ventilation system that saves energy by adjusting the fan speed based on the cooking load
solutions_of_the_month.supporting: ECOAZUR® is the leading intelligent Demand Controlled Kitchen Ventilation (DCKV) system built for professional kitchens. It automatically adjusts exhaust and supply airflow based on real-time cooking activity, helping foodservice facilities to significantly reduce energy costs, greenhouse gas emissions, and improve kitchen comfort. With cloud-based monitoring, scalable deployment, and fast payback (1.5 to 3 years), ECOAZUR® empowers multi-location operators to boost sustainability, lower operating costs, and enhance kitchen comfort across their entire network.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_1: An ECOAZUR® system can safely modulate your hood ventilation between 30% and 100% airflow during cooking operations.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_2: An average family restaurant in Quebec City, Canada, can reduce its carbon footprint by approximately 30 tons of CO₂e per year with ECOAZUR®. Over 15 years of operation, this amounts to a total reduction of around 450 tons of CO₂e.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_3: Operating a fan at 30% airflow can result in energy savings of up to 97%!
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_4: ECOAZUR® reduces unnecessary kitchen air outflow by up to 50%, which means less energy is wasted heating or cooling air that didn’t need to be ventilated in the first place.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_5: By switching to ECOAZUR®, a restaurant can reduce its CO₂ emissions by up to 30% compared to a traditional constant-speed ventilation system—helping fight climate change while saving energy.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_1: Average 40 to 60 % on energy consumption compared to mainstream alternative.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_2: Typical payback period ranging from 1.5 to 3 year.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_3: ECOAZUR saves on average 40 to 60 % on energy consumption compared to mainstream alternative, offering a payback of 1.5-3 years, with no significant recuring costs.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_4: Unlike conventional constant-speed ventilation systems, which are purely an operating expense, Ecoazur pays for itself in just 18 months on average, turning a cost center into a source of long-term savings.

guidesectors.name: Buildings & Constructions
guidesectors.definition: Solutions related to the design, construction, operation, and maintenance of physical structures including residential, commercial, and industrial buildings. The Solutions in this sector aim to promote sustainability and efficiency in the construction and building industry, addressing challenges and innovating across the entire lifecycle of structures.

guidesectors.name: Agrifood & Natural Environment
guidesectors.definition: Solutions related to the farming and cultivation of both food and non-food items, such as textiles and biofuels, and all activities associated in their value chain. The focus extends to Solutions that within agroforestry, ocean preservation, air pollution mitigation, nature-based solutions and biodiversity.

guidesectors.name: Industrial Processes & Consumer Goods
guidesectors.definition: Solutions related to the operations that transform raw materials, components, or substances into finished products on a large scale.  Solutions in this sector strive to optimise processes, reduce environmental impact, and enhance the overall efficiency of industrial activities.  This sector also includes solutions that aim to provide consumer goods for individuals that are more sustainable, circular, and environmentally friendly.

ssf.name: ECOAZUR
ssf.one_sentence_description: A demand-controlled kitchen ventilation system that saves energy by adjusting the fan speed based on the cooking load.
ssf.public_short_description: ECOAZUR® is the leading intelligent Demand Controlled Kitchen Ventilation (DCKV) system built for professional kitchens. It automatically adjusts exhaust and supply airflow based on real-time cooking activity, helping foodservice facilities to significantly reduce energy costs, greenhouse gas emissions, and improve kitchen comfort. With cloud-based monitoring, scalable deployment, and fast payback (1.5 to 3 years), ECOAZUR® empowers multi-location operators to boost sustainability, lower operating costs, and enhance kitchen comfort across their entire network.
ssf.environmental_benefit: ECOAZUR® delivers substantial environmental benefits by drastically reducing the energy consumption of commercial kitchen ventilation systems—one of the most energy-intensive components in foodservice operations. By using intelligent sensors and real-time data to modulate fan speeds based on actual cooking activity, ECOAZUR® cuts fan motor electricity use by up to 97% and reduces the energy required to heat, cool, and dehumidify replacement air by up to 70%. These savings translate into a significant reduction in greenhouse gas emissions. By optimizing energy use without compromising kitchen performance, ECOAZUR® supports large-scale decarbonization in the foodservice industry and makes a meaningful contribution to climate action goals.
ssf.economical_benefit: ECOAZUR® offers significant economic advantages by substantially lowering energy costs in commercial kitchens—often among the highest operational expenses in foodservice. By intelligently adjusting ventilation fan speeds based on real-time cooking activity, clients can reduce their energy consumption by an average of 40% to 60% compared to mainstream alternatives. With a typical payback period of just 1.5 to 3 years, ECOAZUR® delivers rapid ROI, long-term operational savings, and reduced maintenance costs—making it a financially sound investment for multi-site restaurant operators.
ssf.ss_title: Installation of ECOAZUR in all 40 restaurants in Quebec, Canada
ssf.ss_description: Normandin sought to upgrade the kitchen ventilation systems in over 40 of its restaurants to reduce energy consumption and maintenance costs while maintaining staff comfort. Over a 24-month period, the ECOAZUR system—featuring temperature and optical sensors—was installed across all locations.
ssf.ss_case_study_impact:
The results were significant: modulated airflow averaged 70%, with each restaurant cutting approximately 30 tons of greenhouse gas emissions annually. Normandin continues to benchmark restaurant performance to uncover further energy-saving opportunities.

Since 2016, the Normandin restaurant chain is saving a total of 1,200 tons CO2eq each year with the ECOAZUR DCKV.
ssf.ss_grants_recognition:
ENERGY STAR Emerging Technology Award for 2015 (The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
Mercuriade 2025: Innovative Manufacturer (Fédération des chambres de commerce du Québec)
ssf.technical_aspects:
ECOAZUR® is an advanced Demand Controlled Kitchen Ventilation (DCKV) system that uses a network of high-precision sensors and intelligent algorithms to optimize ventilation in commercial kitchens. The system continuously monitors temperature, smoke, and vapor levels in real time, automatically adjusting the speed of exhaust and supply fans to match actual cooking activity. This dynamic control ensures maximum energy efficiency without compromising air quality or kitchen comfort.

Unique Sensor Technology
• Waterproof and grease-proof optical sensors
• Hood/room temperature differential
• Hood & duct pressure
• Intelligent room transmitters (T, RH, CO2, CH4)

Patented Exhaust Modulating Dampers
• Adapts to building constraints efficiently
• Retrofit-friendly design (no cutting or welding)

Connectivity
• Wi-Fi, Ethernet
• Free cloud basic dashboard
• Building Automation System (BACnet/IP, Modbus TCP, Modbus RTU)

Controls
• Exhaust/supply fans & VAV boxes
• Hood lights
• Cooking appliance shutoff devices
• Hood wash systems

Compliance
• IMC, NEC, CEC, NFPA 96
• For new and existing hoods
• c-UL-us (safety), ETL (sanitary), CE

ECOAZUR is protected by two patents:  
• Damper, installation kit for damper and damper kit installation method for cooking operations (USA US10801745B2, CA: CA2925949C, EUROPE: EP3052867C0)
• Methods for operating heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems (CA: CA2875717C).

For detailed technical specifications and documentation, please refer to the ECOAZUR Product Specifications provided by Intellinox.
ssf.human_assets:
The success of ECOAZUR® is rooted in the strength of Intellinox Technologies’ multidisciplinary team and its deep commitment to innovation. Since our founding in 2007, we’ve grown from a 3-person startup to a team of 38 full-time employees, including 9 engineers and 4 programmers. In 2024 alone, we created 11 new jobs in the Quebec City region, reinforcing our role as a regional innovation leader.

Our team’s expertise spans engineering, software development, production, and field service—working in close collaboration to overcome complex technical and logistical challenges. Over 40% of our workforce is dedicated to R&D, ensuring we remain at the forefront of energy efficiency technologies and international certification standards.

This innovation is also supported by our agile production, procurement, and service teams, who rapidly integrate new technologies and maintain high responsiveness to market needs. Field technicians provide continuous feedback from installations, enabling us to enhance our solutions in line with customer expectations.

Our culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence is the foundation of ECOAZUR®’s success. It has allowed us to transform Intellinox into a recognized leader in intelligent energy management for professional kitchens.
ssf.external_threats:
Market Size Estimates
Total Addressable Market (TAM):
The global commercial kitchen ventilation market is valued at ~USD 2.3 billion, projected to exceed USD 3 billion by 2033. This includes all ventilation systems used in restaurants, institutions, and hospitality.

Serviceable Addressable Market (SAM):
ECOAZUR® targets the Demand Controlled Kitchen Ventilation (DCKV) segment, estimated at USD 600–800 million, primarily in North America and Europe.

Share of Market (SOM):
With a growing footprint in Canada and the U.S., Intellinox currently captures an estimated 1% of the SAM (~USD 8 million), with a goal to reach 5–10% in the next 5 years.

Assumptions:
Based on industry reports, DCKV represents ~25–30% of the total market. ECOAZUR®’s retrofit capability and premium positioning allow access to both new and existing kitchens.

Go-to-Market Strategy
1. Target Segments: Multi-site restaurant chains, institutional kitchens, and foodservice consultants.
2. Value Proposition: Up to 97% reduction in fan electricity use, 70% HVAC energy savings, and rapid ROI (1.5–3 years), with cloud-based monitoring and seamless integration.
3. Sales Channels: Direct sales, certified distributors, and partnerships with kitchen equipment manufacturers and ESCOs.
4. Marketing Approach: Trade shows, case studies, ROI tools, and others.
5. Scaling Strategy: Expand throughout Canada and the U.S. via distributors and partnerships.
ssf.mainstream_alternative: The mainstream alternative to ECOAZUR® is the use of traditional constant-speed kitchen ventilation systems, which run exhaust and supply fans at full speed all day, regardless of cooking activity. These systems are still used in over 70% of commercial kitchens and result in high energy use, increased HVAC loads, and elevated operating costs. ECOAZUR® replaces this outdated approach with intelligent, demand-based control for greater efficiency and sustainability.
ssf.business_opportunity:
Several Demand-Controlled Kitchen Ventilation (DCKV) systems exist on the market, including:
Melink Intelli-Hood
Halton M.A.R.V.E.L.
CaptiveAire DCKV System
Gaylord DigiCool

Most of these systems rely primarily on temperature sensors mounted in the hood to regulate exhaust rates. While Melink Intelli-Hood does include optical sensors, they are not robust, not suitable for retrofit projects, and cannot manage multiple hoods on a shared fan system, limiting their flexibility and scalability.


ECOAZUR® addresses these gaps with several key advantages:
Advanced sensing: High-precision optical sensors detect temperature, smoke, and vapor in real time, enabling more accurate and responsive fan control—especially in low-heat, high-vapor cooking scenarios where temperature-only systems fall short.
Robust design: Waterproof, grease-proof stainless-steel sensors built for harsh kitchen environments, requiring no calibration and minimal maintenance.
Modular and retrofit-friendly: Easily integrates with any kitchen layout and most building automation systems, with plug-and-play installation that avoids duct cutting or welding.
Multi-hood management: Capable of controlling multiple hoods on a single fan system, a feature not supported by many competitors.
Cloud-based monitoring: Real-time analytics and performance tracking, offering visibility and control that many alternatives lack.


In summary, ECOAZUR® fills a clear market gap by offering greater energy savings, superior sensing, retrofit flexibility, and advanced data capabilities, delivering unmatched performance and long-term value compared to existing DCKV solutions.
ssf.status:
To scale ECOAZUR®, Intellinox is executing a focused strategy centered on market expansion, strategic partnerships, and operational scalability.

1. Strategic Partnerships
We are actively building partnerships with:
*Multi-site restaurant chains and institutional foodservice providers to deploy ECOAZUR® across multiple locations.
*Engineering firms that design commercial kitchens and HVAC systems, enabling early-stage integration of ECOAZUR® into new builds
*Hood manufacturers to streamline installation and bundling opportunities.
*Energy service companies (ESCOs) and utility programs to leverage incentive structures and financing models that reduce upfront costs for clients.

These partnerships allow us to scale efficiently by leveraging trusted networks and technical expertise across the foodservice and energy sectors.

2. Distribution Channels
We are expanding our network of:
*Certified distributors and installers across Canada, the U.S. and Europe, trained to ensure consistent quality and after-sales support.
*OEM collaborations to integrate ECOAZUR® directly into ventilation systems at the manufacturing stage (hood manufacturers).

3. Market Focus
Our primary growth focus is on Canada, the United States and Europe, where energy efficiency regulations and sustainability goals are accelerating demand. However, we remain open to international agreements and partnerships in markets aligned with our mission.

4. Operational Readiness
We’ve invested in:
*Scalable production capacity and a modular product design that simplifies installation and customization.
*Cloud infrastructure for centralized monitoring and analytics, enabling proactive maintenance and performance optimization at scale.
ssf.summary_market_of_application: An ECOAZUR® system can safely modulate your hood ventilation between 30% and 100% airflow during cooking operations.
ssf.summary_market_of_application_2:
An average family restaurant in Quebec City, Canada, can reduce its carbon footprint by approximately 30 tons of CO₂e per year with ECOAZUR®. 
Over 15 years of operation, this amounts to a total reduction of around 450 tons of CO₂e.
ssf.summary_market_of_application_3: Operating a fan at 30% airflow can result in energy savings of up to 97%!
ssf.sei_case_study_description:
Case Study: ECOAZUR® Installation at Normandin Restaurant – Thetford Mines, Québec
At the Normandin restaurant in Thetford Mines, a traditional On/Off kitchen ventilation system was replaced with the ECOAZUR® Demand-Controlled Kitchen Ventilation (DCKV) solution. The kitchen operates 119 hours per week, with varying cooking intensity throughout the day.

Before ECOAZUR® (Mainstream Alternative):
Constant 100% fan operation, regardless of actual cooking activity.

Annual energy consumption:
34,533 m³ of natural gas (adjusted baseline)
High electricity use from unmodulated fan motors

Environmental impact:
No energy optimization, resulting in unnecessary greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions.

Operational inefficiencies:
Over-ventilation, excessive HVAC load, and higher noise levels.

After ECOAZUR® Installation:
Real-time modulation of fan speeds based on cooking activity, with an average modulation rate of 51%.

Annual energy savings:
19,701 m³ of natural gas
25,625 kWh of electricity on fan motors

Improved thermal efficiency:
Average supply air temperature reduced from 21°C to 18°C, lowering HVAC demand.

Environmental impact:
37 tonnes of CO₂ emissions avoided per year, equivalent to the annual emissions of approximately 8 passenger vehicles.

Additional benefits:
Quieter kitchen environment, extended equipment lifespan, and real-time performance monitoring via cloud dashboard.

Environmental Comparison:
While the traditional system continuously consumes energy without any return, ECOAZUR® transforms ventilation into a smart, responsive system that significantly reduces both energy use and carbon footprint. Over a 10-year period, this installation alone could prevent 370 tonnes of CO₂ emissions, making it a powerful contributor to sustainability goals in the food service industry.
ssf.sei_production_phase:
ECOAZUR® System (Add-on to Existing Ventilation System)
ECOAZUR® is an add-on solution installed on top of a traditional ventilation system. It does not replace the fans or ductwork but adds smart control components to optimize performance.

Total Weight of ECOAZUR® System:
Approximately 13.5 kg

Estimated Materials Breakdown:
Electronics (Control units, sensors, PCBs, wiring): ~6.5–7 kg (≈50% of total weight)
Stainless Steel (sensor housings, brackets): ~3.5 kg
Aluminum (casings, damper frames): ~1.5 kg
Plastic (keypads, covers, wiring insulation): ~1 kg
Rubber & Silicone (seals, gaskets): ~300 g
Glass (optical lenses): ~200 g

Estimated Energy for Assembly:
Electricity: ~100-130 kWh (primarily for fan motor assembly and control panel wiring)

Note: ECOAZUR® is assembled in Québec using pre-manufactured components sourced from specialized suppliers. The system is designed to be compact, modular, and retrofit-friendly.


Mainstream Alternative – Traditional Constant-Speed Ventilation System (Without DCKV)
This system includes exhaust and supply fans, ductwork, and basic control panels, but does not include any demand-controlled ventilation (DCKV) features.

Estimated Materials (for equivalent coverage):
Galvanized Steel (fan housings, ductwork, dampers): ~120–150 kg
Aluminum (fan blades, control panel casing): ~10 kg
Copper (motor windings, wiring): ~1 kg
Rubber & Plastic (fan mounts, insulation): ~2 kg
Electronics (basic control panel): ~2–3 kg

Key Distinction:
ECOAZUR® is a lightweight, intelligent add-on that enhances existing systems with minimal material footprint.
ECOAZUR® requires slightly more energy to manufacture, but this is offset by its massive operational energy savings (up to 97% fan energy and 70% HVAC energy reduction).
ssf.sei_transport:
Material Origin and Transportation – ECOAZUR® vs. Traditional System
ECOAZUR® System (4 Units Installed)
ECOAZUR® is assembled in Québec using pre-manufactured components sourced from specialized suppliers. The company does not produce raw materials such as aluminum, copper, or plastics.

Main Components and Their Origins:
Sensors, Control Units, Dampers, and Actuators
Origin: Sourced from certified suppliers in North America, Europe, and Asia.
Transport: Shipped to Québec via sea freight (for overseas components) and truck (for North American suppliers).

Wiring, Enclosures, and Mounting Hardware
Origin: Pre-fabricated by electronics and hardware manufacturers.
Transport: Delivered to the assembly site by regional logistics providers.

Assembly Location and Energy Use:
Final Assembly: Performed in Québec.

Energy Consumption: Estimated at 180–220 kWh for 4 units, primarily powered by Québec’s low-carbon hydroelectric grid.


Traditional Constant-Speed Ventilation System
These systems are typically manufactured by HVAC equipment providers who also source pre-fabricated components.

Main Components and Their Origins:
Fans, Ducts, and Control Panels
Origin: Manufactured in North America or Asia using galvanized steel, aluminum, and copper.
Transport: Shipped to installation sites via truck or rail.

Assembly and Installation:
Assembly: Often done at the manufacturer’s facility or on-site.
Energy Use: Estimated at 100–130 kWh for equivalent coverage.

Key Distinction:
ECOAZUR® focuses on smart integration and energy efficiency, assembling high-performance components locally. While it relies on global supply chains for parts, its low-carbon assembly process and significant operational energy savings result in a much lower overall environmental footprint compared to traditional systems.
ssf.sei_use_phase:
Hood with ECOAZUR® System – Use Phase (15 Years)
Electricity Consumption: ~100,000 kWh (due to variable-speed fan operation and smart control system)
Natural Gas Consumption: ~126,000 m³ (reduced HVAC load thanks to optimized ventilation)
Water Use: Negligible
Maintenance Resources: Minimal – no calibration required; sensors are grease- and water-proof
Electronics Weight: ~6–8 kg (includes control units, sensors, PCBs, and wiring)
Expected Lifetime: 15 years


Traditional Constant-Speed System Hood – Use Phase (15 Years)
Electricity Consumption: ~340,000 kWh (fans run at full speed regardless of cooking activity)
Natural Gas Consumption: ~420,000 m³ (due to constant ventilation and higher HVAC demand)
Water Use: Negligible
Maintenance Resources: Moderate – frequent motor servicing and duct cleaning required
Electronics Weight: ~2–3 kg (basic control panel and wiring)
Expected Lifetime: 15 years


Hood with Mainstream DCKV Alternatives (Competitors’ Systems) – Use Phase (Estimated for 5-8 Years)
Electricity Consumption: ~150,000–220,000 kWh (depending on sensor accuracy and modulation limits; less efficient than ECOAZUR®)
Natural Gas Consumption: ~250,000–350,000 m³ (due to less precise airflow control and HVAC interaction)
Water Use: Negligible
Maintenance Resources: Moderate to high – sensors may require calibration or replacement; less robust in harsh environments
Electronics Weight: ~4–6 kg (includes temperature sensors, control units, basic optics)
Expected Lifetime: 5–8 years, due to less durable components and limited retrofit compatibility
ssf.sei_disposal_phase:
As ECOAZUR® assembles pre-made components, end-of-life disposal depends on the materials used in those components:
Metal Parts (Stainless Steel, Aluminum, Copper): Typically recyclable through standard metal recycling facilities.
Electronic Components (Sensors, PCBs, Control Units): Should be processed through certified e-waste recycling channels to recover valuable materials and prevent pollution.
Plastics, Rubber, Silicone: Partially recyclable depending on local facilities; otherwise, typically landfilled.
Glass (Optical Lenses): Often landfilled due to small quantities and limited recycling options.
ssf.ei_energy_consumption_1: ECOAZUR® reduces unnecessary kitchen air outflow by up to 50%, which means less energy is wasted heating or cooling air that didn’t need to be ventilated in the first place.
ssf.ei_energy_consumption_2: By switching to ECOAZUR®, a restaurant can reduce its CO₂ emissions by up to 30% compared to a traditional constant-speed ventilation system—helping fight climate change while saving energy.
ssf.economic:
ECOAZUR® offers strong financial benefits for commercial kitchen operators by significantly reducing energy consumption and operational costs. Its intelligent control of ventilation fans and HVAC load leads to measurable savings and a fast return on investment.

Pricing Comparison:
ECOAZUR® System: Typically ranges from $8,000 to $20,000 CAD, depending on kitchen size, number of hoods, and system configuration.
Mainstream Alternatives:
Basic DCKV systems (temperature-only sensors): ~$5,000 to $12,000 CAD
Advanced DCKV systems with optical sensors: ~$12,000 to $20,000 CAD
However, many of these systems lack retrofit compatibility, robust sensor design, or multi-hood management capabilities.


Key Financial Metrics:
Average Payback Period:
18 to 36 months, depending on local energy rates, kitchen size, and operating hours.

Annual Energy Savings per Site:
Combined electricity and natural gas savings can reach $3,000 to $6,000 CAD or more.

Return on Investment (ROI):
Typically exceeds 30–60% annually, especially in high-usage kitchens.

Maintenance Savings:
Reduced wear on fans and HVAC systems leads to lower maintenance and replacement costs over time.
Incentives & Rebates:

ECOAZUR® is eligible for energy efficiency grants and utility rebates in many regions, further improving ROI.
ssf.economic_intensity_detail:
ECOAZUR® has a high capital intensity, similar to other energy-efficiency infrastructure solutions like solar panels or heat recovery systems.

Capital Intensity Breakdown
Initial Capital Investment:
Approximately 95% of the total cost of ownership occurs at the time of purchase and installation. This includes:
Hardware (sensors, control units, dampers)
Installation labor
System integration and commissioning

Operating Costs (15-year lifespan):
ECOAZUR® has very low ongoing costs, primarily limited to:
Occasional maintenance (minimal due to robust, calibration-free sensors)
Cloud monitoring (if applicable, often bundled or subscription-based)


Why This Is Beneficial
Although the upfront investment is significant, the system delivers:
Rapid payback (18–36 months)
Long-term energy savings 
Minimal maintenance costs
No recurring fuel or consumable costs
This high capital intensity is justified by the long lifespan, low operating costs, and strong ROI.
ssf.ef_directly_cheaper_1: Average 40 to 60 % on energy consumption compared to mainstream alternative.
ssf.ef_directly_cheaper_2: Typical payback period ranging from 1.5 to 3 year.
ssf.ef_total_cost_1: ECOAZUR saves on average 40 to 60 % on energy consumption compared to mainstream alternative, offering a payback of 1.5-3 years, with no significant recuring costs.
ssf.ef_total_cost_2: Unlike conventional constant-speed ventilation systems, which are purely an operating expense, Ecoazur pays for itself in just 18 months on average, turning a cost center into a source of long-term savings.

implementationstories.title: ECOAZUR® Adopted by Lahey Hospital in Burlington for Energy-Saving Kitchen Operations
implementationstories.description_client:
Medical centers and hospitals are a great opportunity for energy savings in their commercial kitchens due to the long run time hours and quantity of cooking activity taking place. Lahey Hospital was no exception with 4 large kitchen hoods and 4 exhaust fans to move a large quantity of air all day long.
The ECOAZUR standard system utilizing temperature and optic sensors was a perfect retrofit solution for this facility to ensure the exhaust fans and associated makeup air units would be able to modulate based on the varying cooking activity and operate on an as needed basis. With BACnet communication to the building automation system, bypass variable frequency drives, and a full turnkey installation, ECOAZUR will be continuously saving energy.
implementationstories.description_result: By operating at an average new fan speed of 55%, the system achieves significant energy savings. It reduces electrical consumption by 176,136 kWh annually, resulting in savings of $26,420 per year. Additionally, it provides heating savings of $22,022 and cooling savings of $780 each year. The reduction in CO<sub>2</sub> emissions amounts to 418,768 kg annually, contributing to a more sustainable operation. Overall, the total savings amount to $49,222 USD per year.

implementationstories.title: Installation of ECOAZUR in all 40 restaurants in Quebec, Canada
implementationstories.description_client: Normandin sought to upgrade the kitchen ventilation systems in over 40 of its restaurants to reduce energy consumption and maintenance costs while maintaining staff comfort. Over a 24-month period, the ECOAZUR system—featuring temperature and optical sensors—was installed across all locations.
implementationstories.description_result: The results were significant: modulated airflow averaged 70%, with each restaurant cutting approximately 30 tons of greenhouse gas emissions annually. Normandin continues to benchmark restaurant performance to uncover further energy-saving opportunities. Since 2016, the Normandin restaurant chain is saving a total of 1,200 tons CO<sub>2</sub>eq each year with the ECOAZUR DCKV.

solutions_of_the_month.one_sentence_description: An organic & biodegradable super absorbent polymer to help farmers grow crops with less water and fertilizers
solutions_of_the_month.supporting: Agriculture faces challenges like water scarcity, soil degradation, and excessive fertilizer use, affecting both farmers and the environment. To tackle these, we developed Fasal Amrit, the first certified organic, 100% biodegradable super absorbent polymer made from fruit and vegetable waste. Fasal Amrit absorbs up to 50 times its weight in water, retaining moisture for 5-15 days, reducing irrigation by 40%, and minimizing drought effects. It prevents fertilizer leaching, cutting usage by 20% while enhancing soil health. Fully biodegradable in six months, Fasal Amrit is an eco-friendly alternative to synthetic products. Ongoing trials in sugarcane, maize, vegetables and high-value crops like horticulture crops further validate its impact. By improving water efficiency, reducing costs, and increasing yields, EFP fosters sustainable and climate-resilient farming.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_1: Around the world, there are more than 2 billion people derive their livelihoods from agriculture. This is around 26% of the total population who can be our potential customers.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_2: Just 1 kg of Fasal Amrit can help a farmer reduce water usage by up to 40% while keeping the soil moist for 5-15 days, even in dry conditions.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_3: Fasal Amrit completely breaks down in the soil within six months, leaving no pollution while improving soil health and increasing crop yields by 10-20%.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_4: Fertilizer Savings: Replacing 90 kg/ha of synthetic fertilizers with 20 kg/ha of Fasal Amrit avoids high-carbon urea production (1.2–3.0 kg CO₂e/kg). This substitution lowers emissions while maintaining crop yields.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_5: Transport Efficiency: Locally sourced fruit waste reduces transport emissions by 50%. Unlike synthetic fertilizers that require long-distance shipping, EF Polymer’s decentralized production cuts carbon footprints and aligns with circular economy goals.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_6: Carbon Sequestration: Fasal Amrit boosts soil organic carbon by 27.49%, turning farmland into a carbon sink. This removes CO₂ from the air and enhances long-term soil health resulting in carbon sequestration by 13%.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_7: Waste Upcycling: EF Polymer upcycles 3.6M kg of fruit waste yearly (2025 target). Diverting waste from landfills prevents methane emissions (25x more potent than CO₂) and adds economic value.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_1: Lower upfront cost: Fasal Amrit costs ₹400–500 per acre, whereas synthetic fertilizers (urea, DAP) require ₹1,500–2,000 per acre per season, making it a more affordable initial investment.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_2: Higher yield with less input: Fasal Amrit increases crop yields by 20% due to improved water retention and nutrient availability, ensuring better returns even with reduced fertilizer application.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_3: Quick payback period: Farmers recover their investment in 3–6 months as Fasal Amrit reduces fertilizer expenses while increasing yields, offering higher profits compared to conventional methods.
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_4: Long-term water and cost savings: Fasal Amrit reduces water usage by 30–40%, lowering irrigation costs and diesel consumption for water pumps, making it a cost-effective and sustainable alternative over multiple seasons.

guidesectors.name: Agrifood & Natural Environment
guidesectors.definition: Solutions related to the farming and cultivation of both food and non-food items, such as textiles and biofuels, and all activities associated in their value chain. The focus extends to Solutions that within agroforestry, ocean preservation, air pollution mitigation, nature-based solutions and biodiversity.

ssf.name: Fasal Amrit (Organic Soil Moisturizer)
ssf.one_sentence_description: An organic & biodegradable super absorbent polymer to help farmers grow crops with less water and fertilizers.
ssf.public_short_description: Agriculture faces challenges like water scarcity, soil degradation, and excessive fertilizer use, affecting both farmers and the environment. To tackle these, we developed EF Polymer, the first certified organic, 100% biodegradable super absorbent polymer made from fruit and vegetable waste. EF Polymer absorbs up to 50 times its weight in water, retaining moisture for extended 5-15 days, reducing irrigation by 40%, and minimizing drought effects. It prevents fertilizer leaching, cutting usage by 20% while enhancing soil health. Fully biodegradable in six months, EF Polymer is an eco-friendly alternative to synthetic products. Ongoing trials in sugarcane, maize, vegetables and high-value crops like horticulture crops further validate its impact. By improving water efficiency, reducing costs, and increasing yields, EFP fosters sustainable and climate-resilient farming.
ssf.environmental_benefit: EF Polymer’s primary environmental benefit lies in promoting sustainable farming while tackling organic waste management. Made from biodegradable fruit and vegetable waste, it repurposes discarded materials into a valuable agricultural resource, reducing landfill contributions and associated emissions. By retaining moisture and preventing fertilizer leaching, it enhances soil health and minimizes water and nutrient loss, reducing reliance on chemical inputs. Unlike synthetic alternatives, EF Polymer fully decomposes within six months, leaving no harmful residues and ensuring a zero environmental footprint. This innovative solution supports regenerative agriculture, conserves resources, and protects ecosystems, making farming more resilient to climate challenges.
ssf.economical_benefit: EF Polymer offers significant economic benefits, especially for farmers growing water-intensive crops like potatoes. By spending just €22 per acre, farmers can save up to 40% on irrigation costs and 20% on fertilizers due to EF Polymer's superior water retention and reduced leaching properties. This not only ensures healthier crops but also increases yields, leading to additional profits of approximately €165 per acre. Its organic and biodegradable nature enhances soil health, reducing dependency on chemical fertilizers and frequent irrigation, thereby lowering overall input costs. For high-water-requirement crops, EF Polymer provides a sustainable, cost-effective solution with excellent returns.
ssf.ss_title: Transforming the Desert into a Bounty: A Farmer's Journey with Crop Amrit
ssf.ss_description:
In the arid village of Chandan, Jaisalmer, where the sandy soil and water scarcity made farming difficult, Devi Singh, a cumin farmer, found hope with EF Polymer, a revolutionary super absorbent polymer. Struggling with poor yields, he tried EF Polymer, which promised better water retention and soil fertility. Within weeks, his fields transformed—the soil held moisture, and his cumin plants grew healthier, yielding larger, more aromatic seeds. His harvest exceeded expectations, boosting his income and confidence.

Devi Singh shared his success with fellow farmers, inspiring a wave of change in Jaisalmer. Once barren lands are now thriving, symbolizing agricultural revival. As Devi Singh says, "EF Polymer has been a game-changer. It increased yields and improved livelihoods, bringing hope and prosperity to our community."
ssf.ss_case_study_impact:
Since the solution was used in an acre of farmer's land, the CO2 emission saved was 760 Kgs and approximately 0.72 million litres of water has been saved.

From an economic point of view, Devi Singh was able to increase his revenue by 127 € and his income increase was 102 €. The payback time for the farmer was around 5-6 months because cumin harvesting happened in 4 months and within the next month he was able to sell the cumin. The ROI was 4-5 times.
ssf.ss_grants_recognition: EF Polymer’s Fasal Amrit has received global recognition, including the Okigin Furusato Promotion Fund Award (Japan), Adaptation & Resilience Challenge Award (CDC Group), and Solar Impulse 1000 Efficient Solution. Featured in Forbes Asia 100 to Watch and Forbes Asia 30 Under 30, EF Polymer secured Seed and Series-A funding and achieved sales of over 350 MT, driving global impact by promoting sustainable and cost-effective farming practices.
ssf.technical_aspects:
Solution Technicality
EF Polymer is an innovative and sustainable super absorbent polymer (SAP) derived from fruit and vegetable waste, specifically orange and banana peels. Our process begins with the extraction of pectin, a naturally occurring polysaccharide with excellent gel-forming and water retention properties. This pectin-rich material is then processed using physical binding techniques to create a homogeneous mixture that ensures uniformity in texture and composition. The material undergoes grinding to achieve the optimal particle size for soil application. The final product is packaged as a granular bio-based SAP that absorbs and retains water, gradually releasing moisture to plant roots as needed.

Our methodology is documented in technical research papers and patents, detailing the extraction, binding, and manufacturing processes to ensure replicability and scalability in sustainable agriculture.

(Attached Research Papers: https://tinyurl.com/arv5k75p)

How Traditional SAPs Work in Agriculture
Conventional synthetic SAPs are typically made from polyacrylate-based polymers, which are derived from petroleum-based chemicals. These white, sugar-like granules absorb and store water but are non-biodegradable and can remain in the soil for years, potentially harming soil microbes and long-term soil health.

Traditional SAPs work by absorbing large amounts of water and swelling to form a gel-like structure. Over time, they release water back into the soil, reducing the frequency of irrigation. However, since they are chemical-based, they do not degrade naturally, leading to concerns about environmental pollution.

How EF Polymer is Different from Traditional Chemical-Based SAPs
Unlike synthetic SAPs, EF Polymer is 100% organic and biodegradable. 
(Own Source: https://tinyurl.com/ynukd57j)

The key differences include: 
1. Natural Ingredients: Made from fruit and vegetable waste instead of petroleum-based chemicals.
2. Eco-Friendly Decomposition: Breaks down fully within six months without leaving harmful residues, unlike synthetic SAPs that persist in the soil for years. (Own Source: https://tinyurl.com/4bu7m72k)
3. Soil & Microbial Health: Supports beneficial microbial activity, unlike polyacrylate SAPs that can negatively impact soil biodiversity. 
4. Nutrient Retention: Prevents fertilizer leaching, helping retain essential nutrients in the root zone, reducing fertilizer use by up to 20%.
5. Water Absorption & Release Mechanism (Osmosis Theory)
EF Polymer functions on the principle of osmosis, ensuring efficient water storage and gradual release:
5.1 Water Absorption: When water comes into contact with EF Polymer granules, they swell by absorbing moisture, forming a gel-like structure that stores water within its polymer matrix.
5.2 Controlled Release: As plants experience moisture stress, the root system creates a suction force, pulling water molecules from the gel through osmosis. This ensures a steady supply of moisture, even during dry conditions.
5.3 Repeated Hydration Cycle: The absorption-release cycle can be repeated up to 19 times before the material fully degrades, making it highly effective in reducing irrigation needs by up to 40%.

By integrating bio-based polymers with natural osmosis-driven moisture management, EF Polymer provides a sustainable and effective alternative to synthetic SAPs, helping farmers save water, reduce input costs, and enhance soil health.

ssf.external_threats:
Market Size & Go-To-Market Strategy:
Our Total Addressable Market (TAM) is the global Super Absorbent Polymer (SAP) market, projected to grow from $9.88 billion in 2025 to $17.79 billion by 2034, driven by demand in hygiene, medical, industrial, and agricultural applications (Precedence Research).
The Serviceable Available Market (SAM) focuses on SAPs used in agriculture for water retention, soil health improvement, and drought resilience. Based on industry data, this market is valued at $2.9 billion in 2025 and is expected to grow with increasing climate adaptation measures (Transparency Market Research).
The Serviceable Obtainable Market (SOM) represents the realistic market share we can capture. Using an S-curve adoption model, assuming 5% penetration within five years and a 9% maximum market share, our SOM is projected to reach ~$145 million by 2030 and could grow to $261 million by 2034.

Key Assumptions:
1. Agricultural SAP adoption accelerates post-2024, driven by climate policies and government subsidies.
2. Drought-prone regions lead adoption due to water scarcity concerns and cost savings on irrigation.
3. Market competition, pricing strategies, and awareness efforts will influence adoption rates.

Go-To-Market Strategy:
1. Target Segments → Large-scale farms, smallholder farmers, cooperatives, and government programs.
2. Value Proposition → Reduced irrigation costs, improved crop yields, enhanced drought resilience, and sustainability benefits.
3. Market Entry → Strategic partnerships, pilot projects, distributor networks, government collaborations, and digital marketing.
4. Scaling Advantage → Custom SAP formulations, farmer training programs, policy alignment, and technological innovations.

By executing this strategy, we aim to capture a significant share of the agricultural SAP market, ensuring sustainable growth, global food security, and efficient water management.
ssf.mainstream_alternative: The mainstream alternative to superabsorbent polymers (SAPs) in agriculture is traditional irrigation (flood and drip systems), accounting for over 40% of water usage. Other alternatives include mulching, soil conditioners, and chemical fertilizers with moisture-retaining agents, which are less efficient. SAPs reduce irrigation by up to 40%, increase yield by 25%, and cut fertilizer use by 15%, offering a sustainable, cost-effective solution.
ssf.business_opportunity:
Other Alternatives & How SAPs Stand Out
Besides traditional irrigation methods, other water-retention solutions in agriculture include:
1. Organic Mulching – Using straw, bark, or plastic covers to reduce evaporation. However, it does not store water like SAPs and requires frequent replacement.
2. Chemical Hydrogel-Based Soil Additives – Some alternatives, like acryl amide-based hydrogels, offer excessive water retention and never degrade.
3. Water-Retaining Chemical Fertilizers – Some fertilizers include moisture-absorbing compounds, but they lack SAPs' water-storage capacity and can alter soil chemistry negatively.
4. Clay and Biochar Soil Amendments – These improve soil structure and water-holding capacity but do not actively absorb and release water like SAPs.

How SAPs Are Superior
1. Higher Water Retention – SAPs absorb and store up to 50x their weight in water, releasing it gradually.
2. Increased Yield & Resource Efficiency – They boost crop yields by 25%, cut fertilizer use by 15%, and reduce irrigation needs by 40%.
3. Longer-Lasting Impact – Unlike organic mulch or hydrogel-based fertilizers, SAPs have a lifespan of several years in soil.
4. Sustainability – Reduces water wastage, improves drought resilience, and minimizes chemical runoff.

ssf.sei_case_study_description:
A groundnut farmer in Manpur, Uttar Pradesh, serves as an exemplary case for EF Polymer’s impact. Traditionally, the farmer relied on flood irrigation (6–7 cycles/season) and synthetic fertilizers (90 kg/ha), typical of conventional practices in India’s arid regions. After adopting EF Polymer (5 kg/acre), irrigation frequency dropped to 5 cycles, achieving 18–27% water savings (documented in EF Polymer’s trials). The polymer’s water-retention properties maintained soil moisture for 10–12 days longer, reducing reliance on erratic monsoon rains. Yield increased by 10–12% due to improved nutrient availability and root-zone hydration, while soil organic carbon rose by 13%, reversing degradation from years of chemical use.

(Reference Case Studies: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B4GwgIrfCCh_Y4A6MtKfL6wmOtmZuWBj/view?usp=drive_link)

Environmental Comparison:
1. GHG Emissions: Traditional methods emitted 65.68 million kg CO₂e annually (fertilizer production: 1.2–3.0 kg CO₂e/kg urea; diesel-powered water pumps). EF Polymer’s lifecycle assessment shows 25.21 million kg CO₂e—saving 2,380.54 kg CO₂e/ha by avoiding synthetic inputs and upcycling waste.
2. Water: Conventional farming consumed ~5,000 liters/acre/cycle; EF Polymer reduced this by 30–40% (1,500–2,000 liters saved/cycle).
3. Soil Health: Chemical runoff (common with urea) was eliminated; instead, degraded fields regained porosity and microbial diversity.
ssf.sei_production_phase:
EF Polymer (Solution)
Inputs: 10 kg of wet fruit peels (orange/banana waste) → 1 kg of polymer.
Additives: Plant-derived cellulose (5%), natural root-growth enhancers (3%).
Energy Consumption: ~50 kWh/kg, powered by an Indian grid mix of 70% coal, 20% renewables. Production is decentralized near fruit-processing hubs to minimize transportation emissions.

Synthetic Fertilizers (Mainstream Alternative)
Inputs:
Urea (46% nitrogen), derived from natural gas, emitting 1.5 kg CO₂e per kg.
Phosphates, extracted from mined rock, emitting 2.5 kg CO₂e per kg.
Dosage: Farmers typically apply 90 kg/ha, compared to EF Polymer’s 20 kg/ha.
Energy Consumption: The Haber-Bosch process for urea synthesis consumes 3–5 kWh/kg, requiring high-temperature steam reforming at 1,200°C.
ssf.sei_transport:
EF Polymer
Sourcing: Fruit peels are collected within 50 km of EF Polymer’s Udaipur and Okinawa production hubs from juice factories and farmers, reducing transport-related emissions.
Processing: Uses low-energy mechanical drying (solar-assisted) and enzymatic hydrolysis, avoiding synthetic chemical treatments.
Transport: Lightweight trucks (17 MT capacity, ~50 km avg. distance) minimize fossil fuel consumption.

Synthetic Fertilizers
Sourcing:
Natural gas transported globally (e.g., from the Middle East to India).
Phosphate mining in Morocco, requiring extensive excavation and refinement.
Processing: Highly energy-intensive, using steam reforming (1,200°C) and acid-based rock treatment.
Transport:
Bulk shipping (1,000+ km) via rail/ocean freight.
Final distribution via diesel trucks to rural areas.
ssf.sei_use_phase:
Solution (EF Polymer)
Water Savings: Reduces irrigation needs by 40%. For example, wheat farms require 3,000 liters/acre instead of 5,000 liters.
Energy Efficiency: Cuts diesel-powered irrigation pump usage, saving 15–20 liters/acre per season.
Fertilizer Reduction: Farmers apply 20% less urea (18 kg/ha saved), reducing chemical leaching by 25%.

Mainstream Alternative (Synthetic Fertilizers & Conventional Irrigation)
Water Wastage: Flood irrigation leads to 30% water loss due to evaporation and runoff.
Energy Use: Pumping accounts for 5–10% of farm expenses in India, dependent on diesel or coal-based electricity.
Fertilizer Losses: 30% of synthetic fertilizers leach into groundwater, contributing to nitrate pollution and soil degradation.
ssf.sei_disposal_phase:
EF Polymer (Sustainable End-of-Life)
Degradation: Fully biodegrades in 6 months, breaking down into 27.49% organic carbon and 47.39% soil-enriching organic matter.
Circular Economy: Waste-to-input model upcycles discarded fruit peels, diverting waste from landfills.
Toxicity: Zero residual toxicity, verified by Ecocert and USDA Organic.

Synthetic Fertilizers (Environmental Harm)
Residues: Nitrate contamination of groundwater contributes to "blue baby syndrome" and ecosystem damage.
Soil Degradation: Prolonged use leads to salinization, reducing soil productivity over 5–10 years.
Disposal Challenges: Non-recyclable; incineration releases NOₓ gases, contributing to air pollution.
ssf.ei_energy_usage_1: Carbon Sequestration: EF Polymer boosts soil organic carbon by 27.49%, turning farmland into a carbon sink. This removes CO₂ from the air and enhances long-term soil health resulting in carbon sequestration by 13%.
ssf.ei_energy_usage_2: Waste Upcycling: EF Polymer upcycles 3.6M kg of fruit waste yearly (2025 target). Diverting waste from landfills prevents methane emissions (25x more potent than CO₂) and adds economic value.
ssf.ei_water_savings_1: Irrigation Reduction: EF Polymer reduces water use by 30–40% in crops like wheat and maize. Its water retention (50–100x its weight) ensures slow moisture release, improving efficiency.
ssf.ei_water_savings_2: Drought Resilience: Case studies from Manpur village show EF Polymer extends soil moisture by 10–12 days, reducing irrigation frequency and helping crops survive dry spells.
ssf.economic:
EF Polymer provides a cost-effective and high-return alternative to synthetic fertilizers and expensive irrigation systems. With a price of ₹400–₹500 per kg, a farmer applies 5 kg per acre per season, leading to an investment of ₹2,000–₹2,500 per acre. This cost is comparable to synthetic fertilizers (₹1,800–₹2,200 per acre) but with significantly higher benefits.
Farmers experience a 10–30% yield increase, translating to an additional ₹4,000–₹7,500 per acre in income. Furthermore, EF Polymer reduces synthetic fertilizer use by 20–30%, saving ₹360–₹660 per acre, and decreases irrigation needs by 30–40%, cutting water-pumping costs by ₹1,200–₹2,800 per acre per season. These cumulative savings range between ₹5,500 and ₹10,000 per acre per season, making the investment highly profitable.
The payback period is just one cropping season (3–6 months), with an annual ROI of 100–200%. Compared to high-capital investments like drip irrigation systems (₹25,000–₹40,000 per acre), which have a payback period of 4–5 years, EF Polymer delivers financial benefits far more quickly. Unlike synthetic fertilizers that degrade soil over time, EF Polymer enhances soil health, microbial diversity, and long-term productivity.
In conclusion, EF Polymer stands out as a low-cost, high-impact solution for farmers, providing immediate financial returns, sustainable soil health improvement, and significant water savings, making it a superior choice over conventional alternatives.
ssf.economic_intensity_detail:
EF Polymer is a low-capital-intensity agricultural input, making it highly accessible to small and marginal farmers. Unlike high-capital investments such as irrigation systems or machinery, EF Polymer requires no infrastructure setup or large upfront payments. Farmers can purchase it in small quantities per acre, spreading costs over multiple seasons rather than making a one-time heavy investment. This affordability ensures that even resource-constrained farmers can adopt it without financial strain.
Compared to other agricultural investments, EF Polymer falls under Category B (Limited initial capital intensity, 10-30%). Traditional synthetic fertilizers, for example, also require seasonal purchases, but they contribute to long-term soil degradation and inefficiency due to leaching. Drip irrigation systems, on the other hand, have high capital intensity, requiring substantial investment in pipes, emitters, and pumps, with installation and maintenance costs often exceeding 50% of total irrigation expenses over time. Similarly, tractors and mechanization demand large one-time investments and ongoing fuel and servicing costs.
The cost of adopting EF Polymer remains significantly lower than these alternatives. A farmer using 5 kg per acre incurs a modest upfront cost with no additional expenses for maintenance or installation. Furthermore, its long-term benefits lead to reduced operational costs, as it lowers irrigation needs by 30-40%, cuts fertilizer use by 20-30%, and enhances soil health, reducing dependence on costly chemical inputs. Over time, these savings improve farm profitability, ensuring a strong return on investment (ROI) without the burden of a large capital outlay. By offering an affordable yet impactful solution, EF Polymer aligns with sustainable and cost-effective farming practices, making it an ideal choice for farmers seeking to optimize resource use while maintaining financial stability.
ssf.ef_directly_cheaper_1: Lower cost and input saving: EF Polymer costs just ₹400–500 per acre, compared to ₹1,500–2,000 for synthetic fertilizers, making it a cheaper upfront option. It also helps reduce fertilizer use by 20–30%.
ssf.ef_directly_cheaper_2: Higher yield with fewer inputs: EF Polymer boosts yields by 20% through better water retention and nutrient use, reducing the need for fertilizers.
ssf.ef_total_cost_1: Fast ROI: EF Polymer pays back in 3–6 months by cutting fertilizer costs and boosting yields, leading to higher profits than traditional methods.
ssf.ef_total_cost_2: EF Polymer saves 30–40% water, cutting irrigation and diesel costs, offering a sustainable, cost-effective solution across seasons.

solutions_of_the_month.one_sentence_description: A Electronic Water Conditioner that reduces limescale, prevents bio-fouling & offers chemical-free solutions globally
solutions_of_the_month.supporting:
Industry relies on water for many different purposes. Its unique properties mean that it is particularly efficient at transferring heat, so water is vital to both cooling and heating applications. 

When the state of water is changed, for instance if the water is heated it is less able to hold on to the minerals dissolved in it; they precipitate out to form a hard mass on the surfaces of pipes and equipment, known as calcium carbonate or "limescale," but also phosphate or sulphate scales.  

The layer of scale also forms a thermal barrier, meaning that heat transfer is greatly reduced and leading to major inefficiencies - just 2mm of scale can lead to an efficiency loss of 20%. 

HydroFLOW units induce an electric field into the water and the pipe network to prevent the build-up of hard mineral scale without adding chemicals to the water, keeping equipment running at maximum efficiency and for longer.
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_1: Suitable for pipe sizes from 15mm up to 660mm as standard, with larger units available on request
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_4: Reduction of energy consumption (heating fuel and electricity) due to improved efficiency of exchangers of 10%
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_5: Saving on freshwater of 85% compared to mainstream alternative
solutions_of_the_month.public_key_feature_6: Reduction of chemical antiscalant and biocide of 75%
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_1: Annual saving on water and electricity of $73,000 compared to mainstream alternative
solutions_of_the_month.profitability_2: Annual saving on chemical treatment of $13, 000 compared to mainstream alternative
